body:
@bluebill1049 Here's codesandbox - try changing the version of react-hook-form
https://codesandbox.io/s/crazy-frost-4mf9f

hey i am patching this issue, but please make sure you pass in defaultValue as {} not null

`const { register } = useForm({ defaultValues: data === null ? {} : data });`

hey @cztomsik i think i find out the reason why i made the fix previously, please consider to use `reset()` API instead, the problem it creates with defaultValue get re-assigned each time is that cause infinite re-render due to `defaultValue` with `Object.is` comparison inside each re-render. unless we do a deep compare with the defaultValue object, which in my opinion is heavy and increase the package size.

> passing {} wouldn't help much, because that would fail for deeply nested fields.

you are right.

> But I thought that since this is such common scenario it might be covered - I'd say it's more common than useFieldArray, for example.

You are absolutely right, however, default value needs to be cached, maybe we can reinforce that in the website.
@bluebill1049 np with that, I rather thought about providing some hook (along what I've shown) in the package.

thanks @cztomsik BTW: the cache `defaultValue` was actually trying to resolve a previous bug.

I will leave in this ticket in the backlog and spend some more time investigating for a better alternative solution tho. (I do get your concern :)

> > hey @cztomsik i think i find out the reason why i made the fix previously, please consider to use `reset()` API instead, the problem it creates with defaultValue get re-assigned each time is that cause infinite re-render due to `defaultValue` with `Object.is` comparison inside each re-render. unless we do a deep compare with the defaultValue object, which in my opinion is heavy and increase the package size.
> 
> Consider support custom compare function? such as below usage:
> 
> ```ts
> useForm({
>   defaultValues,
>   defaultValuesDiff: (a,b) => a == null && b != null
> })
> 
> useForm({
>   defaultValues,
>   defaultValuesDiff: (a,b) => a.remote_data == null && b.remote_data != null
> })
> ```

thanks @s97712 you should use `reset()` instead for `defaultValues`, `defaultValues` get cached in the first render.
